Title: Rebate Program for Transformers and Critical Industrial Equipment
Description: $20 million to support the installation of energy efficient distribution transformers and extended product systems that use equipment with electric motors, such as pumps, air compressors, and fans.
Eligible Applicants: Domestic manufacturers, utilites, Tribes, Hospitals, Schools, other operators

Title: Domestic Manufacturing Grants
Description: The Domestic Manufacturing Conversion Grants for electrified vehicles program, will provide cost-shared grants for domestic production of efficient hybrid, plug-in electric hybrid, plug-in electric drive, and hydrogen fuel cell electric vehicles.
Eligible Applicants: Higher Education, For-profit entities, nonprofit entities, SLGs

Title: Innovative Energy and Innovative Supply Chain Loan Guarantee
Description: DOE LPO can finance projects that deploy new or significantly improved high-impact clean energy technology (Innovative Energy) or that employ new or significantly improved technology in the manufacturing process for a qualifying clean energy technology or manufacture innovative products with an eligible technology end-use (Innovative Supply Chain).
Eligible Applicants: Varies

Title: Energy Infrastructure Reinvestment Loan Guarantee
Description: LPO can finance projects that retool, repower, repurpose, or replace energy infrastructure that has ceased operations or enable operating energy infrastructure to avoid, reduce, utilize or sequester air pollutants or greenhouse gas emissions.
Eligible Applicants: Varies

Opportunity Number: Advanced Technology Vehicles Manufacturing Loan Program
Title: Advanced Transportation Direct Loan
Description: Provides direct loans to automotive or component manufacturers for reequipping, expanding, or establishing manufacturing facilities in the U.S. that produce fuel-efficient advanced technology vehicles or qualifying components, or for engineering integration performed in the U.S. for advanced technology vehicles or qualifying components
Eligible Applicants: Varies, but project based

Opportunity Number: Carbon Dioxide Transportation Infrastructure Financing Program
Title: CO2 Transportation Infrastructure Loans and Grants
Description: Offers access to capital for large-capacity, common-carrier carbon dioxide (CO2) transport projects (e.g., pipelines, rail, shipping, and other transport methods)
Eligible Applicants: Varies, but project based

Title: The Green and Resilient Retrofit Program (GRRP)
Description: Funding for direct loans and grants to fund projects that improve energy or water efficiency, enhance indoor air quality or sustainability, implement the use of zero-emission electricity generation, low-emission building materials or processes, energy storage, or building electrification strategies, or address climate resilience, of eligible HUD-assisted multifamily properties.
Eligible Applicants: Owners or purchasers of property in specific HUD programs

Title: Climate Pollution Reduction Grants Program: Implementation Grants
Description: $4.3 billion for the for competitive grants to eligible applicants to implement GHG reduction programs, policies, projects, and measures identified in a PCAP developed under a CPRG planning grant.
Eligible Applicants: Open to entities that received planning grants to develop Priority Climate Action Plans (PCAPs) under phase 1 of the CPRG program, as well as entities that did not directly receive a planning grant

Title: 2023 Clean School Bus Rebates
Description: Funds to incentivize and accelerate the replacement of existing school buses with clean and Zero Emissions (ZE) school buses. Eligible activities include the replacement of existing internal-combustion engine (ICE) school buses with electric, propane, or compressed natural gas (CNG) school buses, as well as the purchase of electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) infrastructure and EVSE installations.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs, Tribes, Non-profts, charter schools

Title: Solar-thermal Fuels and Thermal Energy Storage via Concentrated Solar-thermal energy
Description: This FOA will award up to $30 million for research, development, and demonstration projects in thermochemical storage via solar fuel production and local thermal energy storage (TES) for dispatchable energy.

Title: BIL Battery Materials Processing & Manufacturing Grants
Description: The funding will create new, retrofitted, and expanded domestic facilities for battery-grade processed critical minerals, battery precursor materials, battery components, and cell and pack manufacturing
Eligible Applicants: Individuals, Domestic entitites (National labs, non-profit/for-profit, State/Local Govs, others)

Title: Diesel Emissions Reduction Act (DERA) Grants
Description: Funding assistance to accelerate the upgrade, retrofit, and turnover of the legacy diesel fleet.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs, Tribes, Non-profits

Title: Consumer Electronics Battery Recycling, Reprocessing, and Collection
Description: Funding to support the recycling of consumer electronics batteries and battery-containing devices to help build a robust domestic critical material supply chain for EV batteries in the United States.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs, Research agencies, Non-profits, battery manufactures/retailers, industrial/manufacturing entities, among others

Title: Critical Material Innovation, Efficiency, and Alternatives
Description: This program aims to support the broader government-wide approach to upgrading and modernizing infrastructure, including by strengthening critical domestic manufacturing and associated supply chains to maximize the benefits of the clean energy transition as the nation works to curb the climate crisis, empower workers, and advance environmental justice.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs, Higher Education, For profit entities, non-profit entities

Title: Electric Vehicle Charger Reliability and Accessibility Accelerator
Description: Funding to repair and replace existing, but non-operational, electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure.
Eligible Applicants: State DOTs and local governments

Title: Thriving Communities Program - National Capacity Builder Program and Regional Pilot Program
Description: DOT will award cooperative agreements for capacity builders to provide technical assistance, planning, and capacity building support that advances transformative infrastructure plans, projects, and processes primarily in communities that face high pollution, poor air quality, and persistent poverty.
Eligible Applicants: Non-profts, TA providers (public and private), SLGs, Tribes

Title: Airport Zero Emissions Vehicle & Infrastructure Pilot Program
Description: The program allows airport sponsors to use Airport Improvement Program (AIP) funds to purchase ZEVs and to construct or modify infrastructure needed to use ZEVs.
Eligible Applicants: Any Public Use Airport that is eligible to receieve AIP grants
Prelim Response: Annual deadline for pre-application due Nov 1 each year

Title: Advanced Processing of Critical Minerals and Materials for Industrial and Manufacturing Applications
Description: This Funding Opportunity has two Topic Areas: 1. Advanced Process Development for Production of Rare Earth Metals and Co-Production of Critical Minerals and Materials from Coal-Based Resources; and 2. Production of Critical Minerals and Materials Excluding Rare Earth Materials from Coal-Based Resources.
Eligible Applicants: Individuals, Domestic entitites

Title: The Pioneering Railroad, Oceanic and Plane ELectrification (PROPEL-1K) program
Description: Program will support the research and development of alternative approaches to energy storage to ultimately achieve a > 4x improvement compared to existing state-of-the-art options. The technical scope encompasses electrochemical and/or chemical solutions that do not require hydrocarbon-based fuels (fossil or synthetic).
Eligible Applicants: US Universities, Industry, National Labs, and Individuals

Title: Battery Research and Development Consortium
Description: Activities funded under this Announcement will ensure relevance and responsiveness to the needs of electric vehicle manufacturers via working with, and through a consortium, that brings together a significant fraction of the major manufacturers of electric drive vehicles in the United States, to manage pre-competitive, vehicle-related Research and Development in advanced battery technology, with substantial involvement by the Department of Energy.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs, Tribes, Non-profits, For-profit entities, Other federal agencies, Colleges

Title: Critical Mineral and Rare Earth Study Grants
Description: Funds for Front-End Engineering and Design studies for two different sizes, intermediate-scale and demonstration-scale, of Rare Earth Element Facilities that demonstrate the extraction, separation, and refining from coal and coal by-products to high purity individual or binary rare earth metals and/or critical minerals and materials
Eligible Applicants: Individuals, Higher education institutions, For-profit entites, non-profit entities, Tribes, SLGs

Title: Grid Reslience and Clean Energy Funding
Description: Authorized by the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and administered through the Grid Deployment Office (GDO), the Grid Resilience State and Tribal Formula Grants program is designed to strengthen and modernize America’s power grid against wildfires, extreme weather, and other natural disasters
Eligible Applicants: States, Federally recognized Tribes,

Description: The Low-No Program provides funding to state and local governmental authorities for the purchase or lease of zero-emission and low-emission transit buses, including acquisition, construction, and leasing of required supporting facilities.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs and Tribes

Title: Grants for Buses and Bus Facilities Program
Description: Funds for states and direct recipients to replace, rehabilitate and purchase buses and related equipment and to construct bus-related facilities, including technological changes or innovations to modify low or no emission vehicles or facilities.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs and Tribes

Title: Environmental Justice Thriving Communities Grantmaking Program (EJ TCGM)
Description: Grantmakers will design competitive application and submission processes, award environmental justice subgrants, implement a tracking and reporting system, provide resources and support to communities, all in collaboration with EPA’s Office of Environmental Justice and External Civil Rights.
Eligible Applicants: Entities capable of grantmaking

Title: Advanced Energy Manufacturing and Recycling Grant Program
Description: The FOA will award financial assistance to small- and medium-sized manufacturers in energy communities to 1) establish new facilities or 2) re-equip or expand existing facilities for the manufacturing or recycling of advanced energy property.
Eligible Applicants: Manufacturing firms that fall within certain parameters

Title: Charging and Fueling Infrastructure Discretionary Grant Program
Description: CFI Program investments will make modern and sustainable infrastructure accessible to all drivers of electric, hydrogen, propane, and natural gas vehicles.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs, Planning organizations,

Title: Joint Office of Energy and Transportation Ride and Drive Electric, Fiscal Year 2023 Funding Opportunity Announcement.
Description: Funds will directly advance the goal of building a national network of EV chargers for all Americans by supporting EV charging reliability, resiliency, equity, and workforce development.
Eligible Applicants: Higher Ed, SLGs, Private Sector, Non-profit, Tribal
Prelim Response: Concept Paper required for Full Application submission

Title: DOL Building Pathways to Infrastructure Jobs Grant Program
Description: Funds will train job seekers in advanced manufacturing; information technology; and professional, scientific, and technical services occupations that support renewable energy, transportation, and broadband infrastructure sectors.
Eligible Applicants: Higher Ed, SLGs, Private Sector, Non-profit, Tribal

Title: Reduction of Truck Emissions at Port Facilities
Description: The Reduction of Truck Emissions at Port Facilities program will provide funding to reduce truck idling and emissions at ports, including through the advancement of port electrification.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs, Transportation Providers, Private Sector Applicants

Title: BIL Grid Resilience and Innovation Partnerships (GRIP)
Description: This funding is to enhance grid flexibility and improve the resilience of the power system against growing threats of extreme weather and climate change
Eligible Applicants: States, Federally recognized Tribes, Utilities

Title: Regional Infrastructure Accelerator (RIA) Program
Description: The RIA program accelerates project delivery and clears barriers for credit-worthy projects by funding and encouraging best practices in project planning, studies and analysis, preliminary engineering, and design.
Eligible Applicants: State Transportation Agenices, Planning Organizations

Title: Rebuilding American Infrastructure with Sustainability and Equity (RAISE)
Description: RAISE grants will be awarded for planning or constructing surface transportation infrastructure projects that will improve safety; environmental sustainability; quality of life; mobility and community connectivity; economic competitiveness, among others.
Eligible Applicants: SLGs, Public entity, Public Authority, Tribes, Transit Agency

Title: Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Grid Resilience and Innovative Partnerships (GRIP)
Description: This funding is to enhance grid flexibility and improve the resilience of the power system against growing threats of extreme weather and climate change
Eligible Applicants: States, Federally recognized Tribes, Utilities

Title: Environmental and Climate Justice Community Change Grants Program
Description: The Community Change Grants will fund community-driven projects that address climate challenges and reduce pollution while strengthening communities through thoughtful implementation.
Eligible Applicants: Community based non profit organizations

Title: Critical Materials Accelerator
Description: The Critical Materials Accelerator aims to validate and prototype technologies and processes that address critical materials challenges by developing alternatives, diversifying and expanding supply, increasing manufacturing and material efficiency, and establishing a circular economy.
Eligible Applicants: Higher Education, For-profit entities, Nonprofit entities, SLGs, Tribes

Title: IRA Assistance for Adoption of Latest and Zero Building Energy Codes
Description: Technical assistance competitive grants available for the adoption and implementation of the latest model energy codes, zero energy codes, building performance standards, and innovative codes that achieve equivalent energy savings to the latest model and zero energy codes
Eligible Applicants: Higher Education, For-profit entities, Nonprofit entities, SLGs, Tribes, Code and standards developers, Associations of builders, Local/utility energy efficiency implementers

Title: Electric Drive Vehicle Battery Recycling & Second Life Applications
Description: This NOFO focuses on the research, development, and demonstration of second life applications for electric drive vehicle batteries that have been used to power EVs and technologies and processes for final recycling and disposal of EV batteries.
Eligible Applicants: Higher Education, For-profit entities, Nonprofit entities, SLGs, Tribes, US territories
